trans-unit.source: Navigate to your API app's gateway blade.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to your API app's gateway blade.

trans-unit.source: Click gateway
trans-unit.target: Click gateway

trans-unit.source: In the **Gateway** blade, click **Settings**, and then click **Identity**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Gateway** blade, click **Settings**, and then click **Identity**.

trans-unit.source: Click Settings
trans-unit.target: Click Settings

trans-unit.source: Click Identity
trans-unit.target: Click Identity

trans-unit.source: From the **Identity** blade you can navigate to different blades for configuring authentication using Azure Active Directory and several other providers.
trans-unit.target: From the **Identity** blade you can navigate to different blades for configuring authentication using Azure Active Directory and several other providers.

trans-unit.source: Identity blade
trans-unit.target: Identity blade

trans-unit.source: Choose the identity provider you want to use, and follow the steps in the corresponding article to configure your API app with that provider.
trans-unit.target: Choose the identity provider you want to use, and follow the steps in the corresponding article to configure your API app with that provider.

trans-unit.source: These articles were written for mobile apps, but the procedures are the same for API apps.
trans-unit.target: These articles were written for mobile apps, but the procedures are the same for API apps.

trans-unit.source: Some of the procedures require you to use the [Azure portal].
trans-unit.target: Some of the procedures require you to use the [Azure portal].

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Account
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Account

trans-unit.source: Facebook login
trans-unit.target: Facebook login

trans-unit.source: Twitter login
trans-unit.target: Twitter login

trans-unit.source: Google login
trans-unit.target: Google login

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: As an example, the following screen shots show what you should see in the [Azure portal] pages and [Azure preview portal] blades after you have set up Azure Active Directory authentication.
trans-unit.target: As an example, the following screen shots show what you should see in the [Azure portal] pages and [Azure preview portal] blades after you have set up Azure Active Directory authentication.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure preview portal, The **Azure Active Directory** blade has a **Client ID** from the application you created in the Azure Active Directory tab of the Azure portal, and **Allowed Tenants** has your Azure Active Directory tenant (for example, "contoso.onmicrosoft.com").
trans-unit.target: In the Azure preview portal, The **Azure Active Directory** blade has a **Client ID** from the application you created in the Azure Active Directory tab of the Azure portal, and **Allowed Tenants** has your Azure Active Directory tenant (for example, "contoso.onmicrosoft.com").

trans-unit.source: Azure Active Directory blade
trans-unit.target: Azure Active Directory blade

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, the **Configure** tab for the application you created in the **Azure Active Directory** tab has the **Sign-on URL**, **App ID URI**, and **Reply URL** from the **Azure Active Directory** blade in the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, the **Configure** tab for the application you created in the **Azure Active Directory** tab has the **Sign-on URL**, **App ID URI**, and **Reply URL** from the **Azure Active Directory** blade in the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: (The Reply URL in the image shows the same URL twice, once with `http:` and once with `https:`.)
trans-unit.target: (The Reply URL in the image shows the same URL twice, once with `http:` and once with `https:`.)
